title: 107_hr5198
content: The Act may be cited as the "Premier Certified Lenders Program Improvement Act of 2002". The Premier Certified Lenders Program (PCLP) has been successful in helping small businesses expand. Increasing the number of premier certified lenders will provide more resources to small businesses as the Small Business Administration downsizes. Requiring premier certified lenders to maintain large loss reserve accounts is inefficient and limits their ability to serve additional small businesses. Premier certified lenders should be required to. Premier certified lenders should maintain loss reserve accounts in amounts reflecting the risk of loss associated with PCLP loans to improve efficiency and help small businesses create economic development. SEC. 3. ALTERNATIVE LOSS RESERVE FOR CERTAIN PREMIER CERTIFIED LENDERS. SEC. 3. ALTERNATIVE LOSS RESERVE FOR CERTAIN PREMIER CERTIFIED LENDERS. In General, Section 508(c) of the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 is amended to allow qualified high loss reserve PCLs to elect alternative loss reserve requirements in place of existing ones. Contributions may be waived for PCLs making this election. Qualified high loss reserve PCLs can elect alternative loss reserve requirements, waiving contributions for the quarter if the loss reserve is at least $25,000 and sufficient to cover potential losses. The company must maintain a loss reserve of at least $25,000, determined by a third-party auditor, to protect the Federal Government from risks associated with PCLP loans. Qualified high loss reserve PCL refers to premier certified lenders meeting specific loss reserve criteria. Premier certified lenders must maintain a loss reserve of at least $25,000 and analyze the risk of loss for PCLP loans. Qualified high loss reserve PCL refers to lenders meeting specific criteria. In order to qualify as a Premier certified lender, a company must have a third-party auditor certify that their loss reserve is sufficient to protect the Federal Government from the risk of loss associated with their portfolio of PCLP loans. To qualify as a Premier certified lender, a company must have a third-party auditor certify that their loss reserve is sufficient to protect the Federal Government from the risk of loss associated with their PCLP loan portfolio. A PCLP loan is any loan guaranteed under this section, and a calendar quarter is defined as a period from January 1 to March 31 or April 1 onwards. The term 'calendar quarter' is defined as a period from January 1 to March 31, April 1 to June 30, July 1 to September 30, or October 1 to December 31. Additionally, a conforming amendment is made to the Small Business Investment Act of 1958.
